page.title: 08PAGE 7 CONTINUED
page.content: in the Scunthorpe area. The rest of Atkinsons Warren is left wild but is in danger of being turned into another industrial site.At the moment it is desolate and there is many different species of wildlife. In 1910 all of the warren was woodland.Part of it was cut down to provide a place for the new steelwork's slagheaps.These slagheaps are still here,but,plans are being made to clear them away for a housing estate. People that use the warren for either leisure or work were interviewed.They all liked the buildings for convenience and provision of jobs in an area which has many unemployed,but, they all wanted the warren to stay a place of nature.
